@id.description: The unique identifier of the Digital Specimen object, follows the Digital Object Identifier (DOI) standard

@type.description: The type of the object, in this case ods:DigitalSpecimen

dcterms:identifier.description: The unique identifier of the Digital Specimen object, follows the Digital Object Identifier (DOI) standard.

ods:version.description: The version of the object, each change generates a new version. The version starts at 1 and each change will increment the version number with 1

ods:status.description: The status of the Digital Object. A digital object can be in Draft, when it is not published yet. Active when it is published and the object is active and Tombstone which means the object has been archived.

dcterms:modified.description: The timestamp that the object was last changed, which resulted in a new version of the object. Following the ISO Date Time Format yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX

dcterms:created.description: The timestamp that the object was created in DiSSCo. following the ISO Date Time Format yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX"

ods:fdoType.description: The DOI to the FDO type of the object

ods:midsLevel.description: The level of the Minimum Information about a Digital Specimen of the object, for the full specification see https://www.tdwg.org/community/cd/mids/

ods:normalisedPhysicalSpecimenID.description: The physical specimen identifier of the object. When locally unique this is a combination between source-system-id and the local identifier. This identifier is used to check if an object exists in the DiSSCo infrastructure when the DOI is not available.

ods:physicalSpecimenID.description: The physical specimen identifier of the object. The main identifier of the object is used (which can be indicated by the user through the DataMapping). If the ods:physicalSpecimenIDType is Resolvable or Global, this identifier is the same as the `ods:normalisedPhysicalSpecimenID`

ods:physicalSpecimenIDType.description: To indicate if type of the physical identifier, Resolvable means a resolvable identifier over the internet such as a PURL, Global means a globally unique identifier such as a UUID, Local means a locally identifier unique only within the dataset.

ods:isKnownToContainMedia.description: Indicates if there are any media objects attached to this specimen

ods:sourceSystemID.description: The handle to the source system object which retrieved the data from the CMS

ods:sourceSystemName.description: The name of the source system as provided to DiSSCo
examples: Chelicerata collection (TSZCh) The Arctic University Museum of Norway

ods:livingOrPreserved.description: Whether the specimen is living or preserved

ods:metadataLanguages.description: The language of the Digital Specimen metadata. Only indicate, not enforced. Recommended to use three letter code from ISO 639-2 codes found on https://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/iso639-2.html

dcterms:license.description: A legal document giving official permission to do something with the resource.

dwc:basisOfRecord.description: The specific nature of the data record

ods:organisationCode.description: The name (or acronym) in use by the institution having custody of the object(s) or information referred to in the record.

ods:organisationID.description: ROR or Wikidata identifier of the organisation

ods:organisationName.description: Primary organisation name according to ROR or Wikidata

dwc:collectionCode.description: The name, acronym, coden, or initialism identifying the collection or data set from which the record was derived

dwc:collectionID.description: An identifier for the collection or dataset from which the record was derived

ods:topicOrigin.description: Highest-level terms identifying the fundamentals of the activities, in which context the objects in the collection were collected

ods:topicDomain.description: High-level terms providing general domain information with which the objects are associated

ods:topicDiscipline.description: Overarching classification of the scientific discipline to which the objects within the collection belong or are related

ods:topicCategory.description: Countable things (objects) served as a more detailed classification of each of the disciplines

ods:specimenName.description: The accepted specimen name of the digital specimen

dwc:informationWithheld.description: Additional information that exists, but that has not been shared in the given record
examples: location information not given for endangered species

dwc:preparations.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of preparations and preservation methods for a ods:SpecimenPart

dwc:disposition.description: The current state of a specimen with respect to a collection

ods:isMarkedAsType.description: The material entity is marked as a type specimen

dwc:dataGeneralizations.description: Actions taken to make the shared data less specific or complete than in its original form. Suggests that alternative data of higher quality may be available on request
examples: Coordinates generalized from original GPS coordinates to the nearest half degree grid cell.

ods:ownerOrganisationCode.description: The name (or acronym) in use by the institution having ownership of the object(s) or information referred to in the record

dwc:datasetName.description: The name identifying the data set from which the record was derived

dwc:datasetID.description: An identifier for the set of data. May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to a collection or institution

dcterms:accessRights.description: Information about who access the resource or an indication of its security status. Access Rights may include information regarding access or restrictions based on privacy, security, or other policies

dcterms:rightsHolder.description: A person or organization owning or managing rights over the resource
examples: Museu de História Natural e da Ciência da Universidade do Porto

dwc:organismID.description: An identifier for the organism instance. May be a globally unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set

dwc:organismName.description: A textual name or label assigned to an organism instance

dwc:organismScope.description: A description of the kind of organism instance. Can be used to indicate whether the organism instance represents a discrete organism or if it represents a particular type of aggregation

dwc:organismRemarks.description: Comments or notes about the organism
examples: One of a litter of six
Organism has been split up into multiple specimen, some of which are in different institutions

dwc:organismQuantity.description: A number or enumeration value for the quantity of organisms

dwc:organismQuantityType.description: A dwc:organismQuantityType must have a corresponding dwc:organismQuantity

dwc:verbatimLabel.description: The content of this term should include no embellishments, prefixes, headers or other additions made to the text. Abbreviations must not be expanded and supposed misspellings must not be corrected. Lines or breakpoints between blocks of text that could be verified by seeing the original labels or images of them may be used. Examples of material entities include preserved specimens, fossil specimens, and material samples. Best practice is to use UTF-8 for all characters
examples:
ILL: Union Co. Wolf Lake by Powder Plant Bridge. 1 March 1975 Coll. S. Ketzler, S. Herbert

Monotoma longicollis 4 ♂ Det TC McElrath 2018

INHS Insect Collection 456782

dwc:dynamicProperties.description: A list of additional measurements, facts, characteristics, or assertions about the record. Meant to provide a mechanism for structured content

ods:hasSpecimenParts.description: Contains all specimen parts that are part of this Digital Specimen based on for example a shared registration number

ods:hasAssertions.description: Contains any assertions that can be made about the specimen, such as measurements

ods:hasEntityRelationships.description: Contains relationships to external resources that provide further information about the specimen, for example about the taxonomy or the organisation

ods:hasIdentifications.description: Contains all identification that have been made on the specimen

ods:hasIdentifiers.description: Contains all identifiers that are connected to the specimen, either about the physical or digital specimen

ods:hasCitations.description: Contains information about any publication in which this specimen is mentioned

ods:hasAgents.description: Contains all agents that are connected to the specimen. Agents that are part of a specific part of the specimen should be added there. For example a Collector is connected to the CollectingEvent so is add in the event

ods:hasEvents.description: Contains information about any events that occurred specifically on the specimen part, for example a sampling event

ods:hasTombstoneMetadata.description: Object containing the tombstone metadata of the object. Only present when ods:status is ods:Tombstone
